page.title: 11ST MARGARETS AT CLIFFE
page.content: The community is physically split into 2 villages. One is on the bay of St Margarets the other is centred around the church 1km in land. This is about the second. The church existed in 1086 when the Survey called it Sancta Margarita. The present large building is chiefly 12th century Norman. Farming,fishing and smuggling appear to have been the main occupations up to 1865 when Lord Granville decided to develop the village as a holiday resort. It became a quiet and select retreat by the 1930's. The war saw the town taken over the military but since 1945 the development of the motor car has helped revive the village. An R.A.F. station became a holiday camp in 1960. This has developed into the Country Club,a 55 unit,self_catering holiday village with a pool,open to non_residents.
